message.content:
Step 1: Identify the required values.  
• Total Revenue (or Main Business Revenue) from the income statement = 6,920,513.79  
• Total Current Assets at the beginning (balance sheet at 2023-12-31) = 8,000,000.00  
• Total Current Assets at the end (balance sheet at 2024-01-31) = 7,664,945.72  

Step 2: Calculate the average current assets.  
Average Current Assets = (Beginning Current Assets + Ending Current Assets) / 2  
= (8,000,000.00 + 7,664,945.72) / 2  
= 15,664,945.72 / 2  
≈ 7,832,472.86  

Step 3: Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio.  
Current Assets Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Current Assets  
= 6,920,513.79 / 7,832,472.86  
≈ 0.883  

Rounded to two decimals, the ratio is approximately 0.88.

Thus, the answer in the required JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.88"
  }
}
